means: （使）焊接，焊合( solder的现在分词 )

word_mean: 使用软钎料(一般熔点低于450℃)进行的钎焊。

sentence.Network_en: Care must be exercised in attaching the lead wires to the soldering tabs.
sentence.Network_cn: 在往接线片上焊导线时必须非常小心.

sentence.Network_en: I suggest posing me with a soldering wand over my head like a sword.

entry.def: If you solder two pieces of metal together, you join them by melting a small piece of soft metal and putting it between them so that it holds them together after it has cooled.

example.ex: Fewer workers are needed to solder circuit boards...
example.tran: 焊接电路板需要的工人更少了。

example.ex: He then soldered the wire to the telephone terminal...
example.tran: 接着他把电话线焊接到电话机上。

entry.def: Solder is the soft metal used for soldering.

auth_sentence.content: Never start soldering unless the iron is well tinned.
auth_sentence.res_content: Never start soldering unless the iron is well tinned.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Never start soldering unless the iron is well tinned.

auth_sentence.content: Use a hot soldering iron and plenty of flux.
auth_sentence.res_content: Use a hot soldering iron and plenty of flux.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Use a hot soldering iron and plenty of flux.

auth_sentence.content: When I studied electronics I learned that improper positioning and soldering could cause happy little RF broadcast antennas.
